title: Equipment review: Nike Golf HyperAdapt Jacket
data: More Golf: Leaderboard | Rankings | Schedule | Expert Picks | Equipment | FedEx CupI got a nice little surprise in the mail a few weeks ago when Nike sent me its new HyperAdapt Golf jacket. I love getting new golf equipment and especially when I don't know it's coming.You can see how sharp it looks above but let me tell you a little bit more about it with a quick equipment Q&A.What's your favorite thing about it?Somehow it's both light and heavy at the same time. I would wear it in 65-degree weather and 30-degree weather. It's flexible and waterproof so you're good to go for pretty much any kind of weather you incur on the course.Does it look good?Absolutely. I'm a pretty traditional guy when it comes to style on and off the course (not a big fan of Rickie Fowler's closet) and this fits the bill. The jacket Nike sent me is actually the most modern of its three designs and I think all three are really strong looks.Do you have more photos?Yes, let's jump in.Here's the box Nike sent it in. It's really heavy and a created a strong first impression.This is at the top of the zipper part, up by the beck. It's my favorite part of the jacket.I love the neon outlines.Like I said, any kind of weather.Where can I buy it?Right here at the Nike store.How much does it cost?$280, and worth every penny.So how would you rank it?9/10For more golf news, rumors and analysis, follow @EyeOnGolf and @KylePorterCBS on Twitter or Google+ and like us on Facebook.
